books.title: Poetry
books.author: W. B. Yeats
books.summary: A collection of poems by W. B. Yeats.

books.title: After London
books.author: Richard Jefferies
books.summary: A young man tries to understand his place in the world as he explores a post-apocalyptic England.

books.title: Memoirs of a Foxhunting Man
books.author: Siegfried Sassoon
books.summary: A young boy comes of age in the idyllic English countryside just before the Great War tears Europe apart.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Catriona
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After coming into his fortune and evading his uncle’s schemes, young gentleman David Balfour continues his adventures in 18th century Scotland, helping a politically unwelcome friend escape into France, avoiding the hangman himself, finding his place as a gentleman in Edinburgh society, and falling in love with the daughter of a notorious Macgregor clansman.

books.title: An Ideal Husband
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: Over the course of twenty-four hours, a blackmail plot threatens to bring down a member of the British aristocracy.

books.title: Titus Andronicus
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A blood feud erupts between a famous Roman general and the Queen of the Goths.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: Adam’s Breed
books.author: Radclyffe Hall
books.summary: The child of Italian immigrants struggles to find meaning in Edwardian-era London.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Bolshevik Myth
books.author: Alexander Berkman
books.summary: A left-wing radical records his experiences in revolutionary Russia.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: The Public and Its Problems
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A discussion of the political philosophy of a democratic society.

books.title: A General View of Positivism
books.author: Auguste Comte
books.summary: A brief overview of the goals and methods of the Positivist philosophical movement.

books.title: Songs of a Sourdough
books.author: Robert W. Service
books.summary: A collection of poems about the Klondike Gold Rush.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: Armageddon 2419 A.D.
books.author: Philip Francis Nowlan
books.summary: Adventure hero Buck Rogers battles the forces of the evil Han Empire in 2419 America.

books.title: The Extraordinary Adventures of Arsène Lupin, Gentleman-Burglar
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: An infamous French thief plans intricate ways of stealing precious paintings and jewellery in this first collection of Arsène Lupin short stories.

books.title: The Pursuit of God
books.author: A. W. Tozer
books.summary: A. W. Tozer’s classic work on Christian living, containing practical advice for those who wish to know God, not simply know about Him.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.
